snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo is not known for kindness in the political arena, but Mayor Bill de Blasio is not doing himself any favors either.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column examines public squabbling between New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo and New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio; contends neither leader is without fault in fray, and says there is more than enough blame for both of them to take on a hefty share.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo is not known for kindness in the political arena, but Mayor Bill de Blasio is not doing himself any favors either.

headline.print_headline: De Blasio and Cuomo Point Fingers, but There’s Enough Blame for Both
headline.main: Mayor de Blasio and Governor Cuomo Point Fingers, but There’s Enough Blame for Both
